page.title: 11HALL O' TH' WOOD
page.content: The Hall O' Th' Wood was built for the first Sheriff of Cheshire who was named George Wood.It is approximately 500 yrs old but nobody knows the exact age of the building and it is the only listed building in the parish. It is built of oak and brick and the plaster of wattle and daub.The oak beams are held together by pegs and the present owners have done no major alterations to it since moving there 10 yrs ago. George Wood is said to have built the house here because you could see as far as the Lake District.Queen Elizabeth 1st is also believed tohave slept here and it is thought that the builder of nearby Little Moreton Hall also built the Hall O' Th' Wood.It used to be a working farm until this century and my grandfather owned until he moved to Domvilles Farm (J.O.)J.Oulton,A.Wemyss
